definition: To look or stare with sullen dislike, discontent, or anger.
example: The coach stood on the sidelines, glowering at the referee after the controversial call.
The esurient children eagerly awaited the start of the holiday feast.

definition: The quality of being just; righteousness, equitableness, or moral rightness.
example: The protesters marched through the streets demanding justice for the victims.

definition: Having qualities that give great pleasure or satisfaction to see, hear, think about, etc.
example: The sunset over the ocean was one of the most beautiful sights I had ever seen.

definition: A nocturnal burrowing mammal with a long snout, sticky tongue, and powerful claws.
example: The aardvark uses its claws to dig into termite mounds.

definition: An ancient calculating tool consisting of beads on rods.
example: The merchant used an abacus to total the bill.

definition: An edible sea snail with a shell lined with mother-of-pearl.
example: The diver found a large abalone on the reef.

definition: To leave completely and finally; forsake utterly.
example: They had to abandon the ship during the storm.

definition: To shorten a word or phrase by omitting letters.
To renounce or relinquish a throne, right, power, or claim.
example: The king decided to abdicate in favor of his son.
